page.title: 07ONE DAYS FARMING IN RUNCORN
page.content: { Farm:Manor farm.Month:June. {Weather:Warm,dry,sunny. The farmer rose at 6.45am,had breakfast,then fed calves and collected eggs.He then turned the hay in one field.At 9.30am he cut more hay in another field.He left it piled high to dry.After lunch at the farmhouse he returned to the fields with the baler to make hay bales.A fault with the baler meant a journey to a near by town,Warrington,to buy replacement parts. The remainder of the afternoon was spent repairing the baler.Having eaten his evening meal,the farmer continued baling the hay and stacked the bales in the hay loft.He finally finished his days work at 10.00pm
